summary: This document outlines a request for scanning and automation assistance from the FBI's Document Conversion Laboratory in relation to an obstruction of justice case against Alfredo Rodriguez, who was the former house manager for Jeffrey Epstein. The document details the handling of telephone records believed to be associated with Epstein and potential underage victims.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.context: Rodriguez is the subject of an obstruction of justice case for attempting to sell an address book containing names and numbers of potential underage victims of Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Epstein is referenced as the subject of a child prostitution case, with Rodriguez having been his house manager.

persons.name: Sherrelle Wallace
persons.context: Wallace is mentioned as the contact person from the Miami office coordinating the request for scanning assistance.

persons.name: Michael J Donohoe
persons.context: Donohoe is noted as the approving official for the document.

persons.name: William T. Murphy
persons.context: Murphy is mentioned as part of the Records Management team receiving the request.

persons.name: John Sinskie
persons.context: Sinskie is mentioned as part of the Special Technology team involved in the request.

persons.name: William Oswald
persons.context: Oswald is mentioned as part of the Special Technology team involved in the request.

persons.name: Raquel Steinberg
persons.context: Steinberg is mentioned in relation to telephone records associated with the case.

persons.name: Kerrie Baglio
persons.context: Baglio is mentioned in relation to telephone records associated with the case.

persons.name: Adrian M Holloway
persons.context: Holloway is mentioned in relation to telephone records associated with the case.

persons.name: Susan Renneker
persons.context: Renneker is mentioned in relation to telephone records associated with the case.

connections.description: Rodriguez was employed as the house manager and butler for Epstein.
Wallace is the FBI contact coordinating the request related to Rodriguez's case.
Steinberg's telephone records are associated with Rodriguez's investigation.
Baglio's telephone records are associated with Rodriguez's investigation.
Holloway's telephone records are associated with Rodriguez's investigation.
Renneker's telephone records are associated with Rodriguez's investigation.

events.title: Opening of Obstruction of Justice Case
events.description: The Miami Division opened an obstruction of justice case against Alfredo Rodriguez.

events.title: Telephone Records Generation
events.description: Telephone records were generated in relation to the investigation of Rodriguez and Epstein.

keyFacts: Alfredo Rodriguez attempted to sell an address book containing names and numbers of potential underage victims of Epstein.
Rodriguez was the former house manager and butler to Jeffrey Epstein.
The Miami Division opened an obstruction of justice case against Rodriguez in October 2009.
Telephone records obtained from the address book are believed to belong to Epstein and his associates or potential underage victims.
The document requests scanning and automation assistance for the investigation.
